Building Public Trust
COVID-19 Recovery
Responsible Stewardship of City Resources
Create Mayor's Office of Neighborhood Safety and Engagement.
Establish monthly PoliceStat meetings to build stronger accountability within BPD and improve service delivery.
Set clear, coordinated public safety vision that addresses violence today and root causes.
Task Mayor's Office of Neighborhood Safety and Engagement with coordinating public safety strategy.
Introduce local housing voucher program.
Adopt and support Complete Streets manual increase quality of life and mobility in Baltimore.
Begin implementing a Group Violence Reduction Strategy.
Proactively deploy City agencies to address environmental concerns that contribute to neighborhood safety.
Meet with community leaders and residents around a shared vision for public safety.
Convene the first meeting of the Public Safety Advisory Commission.
Hire Baltimore's first Chief Equity Officer.
Hire a Digital Equity Director.
Identify a senior official in each agency to be responsible for equity and sustainable action.
Commit to Baltimore's zero waste goals and begin shifts toward a more sustainable city.
Elevate Sustainability Director to a cabinet-level position.
Remove the most vulnerable residents from tax sale.
Announce a back-to-basics community development strategy that centers community input.
Create a Neighborhood Stat to track progress on retention, attraction, and growth in neighborhoods.
Begin top-to-bottom review of the procurement process.
Activate small and local business preference in the procurement process.
Prioritize tracking data for City developments and projects that receive TIFs around local hiring and workforce development.
Establish a Hiring Task Force to review HR practices, policy interventions, best practices, and barriers through a lens of equity and meet workforce needs.
Establish a resident preference program for City jobs.
Prioritize the Baltimore Greenway Trails Network.
Join Climate Mayors in supporting the spirit and goals of the Paris Climate Agreement.
Support the overrides of the Blueprint for Maryland's Future and Built to Learn.
Prepare to significantly increase the capacity of virtual YouthWorks in 2021.
Begin implementation of the Elijah Cummings Healing City Act to ensure trauma-informed practice across city government.
Develop plan for equitable and age-appropriate access in partnership with sports, arts, and cultural institutions that create recreational services during this unprecedented pandemic.
Hire Baltimore's first Chief Administrative Officer.
Kick off community engagement plan to introduce Chief Administrative Officer and other senior officials to public.
Establish a regular Stat program to ensure greater accountability and more equitable service delivery across City government.
Restore recycling services, which were suspended due to COVID-19.
Announce plan to reform the water billing program.
Appoint a permanent Housing Commissioner.
Appoint a permanent Homeless Services director.
Initiate a Fix-it First campaign to fill backlog of transportation and infrastructure related 311 service requests, particularly where there has historically been a longer response time.
Publish a clear and concise set of procedures to apply for and receive city-owned properties for development.
Make stronger commitments to cleaning up sewage backups.
Develop and communicate a COVID-19 vaccination prioritization strategy.
Create a dashboard to track CARES act funding to ensure equitable distribution.
Use Rapid Rehousing CARES Act dollars to move 500 people and families to more permanent housing.
Extend emergency shelter in local hotels when CARES Act funding expires.
Cap restaurant delivery fees on third-party app services.
Identify clear point of contact for local businesses to more effectively navigate city government.
Begin holistic, top-to-bottom assessment of city agencies and process to inventory city property.
Begin a holistic review of tax credits to address inefficiencies, redundancies, or new credits that would build a more equitable city.
Announce new criteria for evaluation of capital budget requests.
Expand community engagement in the budget process.
Commit to updating the City's 10-year financial plan.
Design and release Open Checkbook for Baltimore to increase transparency and accountability.
